item.title: Chuck Berry - Sweet Little Sixteen
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C
Chords Used: G7, C, F
As performed by Chuck Berry
Tutorial Video (GCEA): https://youtu.be/qvXLcSfORcU
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And please visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Steve Miller Band - Rock 'n' Me
item.description: Chords: F, C, B-flat See Riff Practice Video: https://youtu.be/o-CP4fPDI0o

item.title: Eagle-Eye Cherry - Save Tonight
item.description: Chords: Am, F, C, G Possible Strum: D- D- D- DU

item.title: The Allman Brothers Band - Midnight Rider
Dire Straits - Sultans of Swing
item.description: Chords: Dm, C, F, B-flat, A Strum pattern - Included in the video Go to this video to practice the Riff with Quick Changes!!!: https://youtu.be/DfZEcfxpsW0

item.title: Chicago - 25 or 6 to 4
item.description: Am, Am6, Am7, E7, F, C, G

item.title: The Rolling Stones - Miss You (Remastered 1993)
item.description:
Chords: Am & Dm (mostly)...and minimal F, Em, and E7.
Want to keep it simple? See this link for a video WITHOUT tab/picking for the melodic riff: https://youtu.be/WBjxpKto00s

item.title: Carpenter Brut - Turbo Killer
item.description:
Performed & written by Carpenter Brut
Something for those who fancy a challenge. Also, not many synthwave play-alongs around.

item.title: Johnny Cash and the Tennessee Two - Folsom Prison Blues
item.description:
For educational use. Folsom Prison Blues by Johnny Cash. Key of G (G, G7, C, Hawaiian D7). Note: This is in a higher key than the original song (see the version for the Key of F if interested in singing at the original pitch). I apologize that this makes Johnny's voice sound a little funny, but these chords approximate the written version in Jim Beloff's "The Daily Ukulele" or "The Yellow Book."
Whenever I attend a ukulele jam, this song is requested. I am attempting to make play alongs for songs that are fun to play, and for those that are commonly requested at ukulele jams, so that young/new players can feel at home in those jam sessions, being familiar with the "genre" of "popular" ukulele songs.
All rights remain with the music company who holds Johnny Cash's work; any advertisements that appear are for that company--not for this channel.
The ukulele font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com
Created using Keynote (layout, text, & lyrics) Keepvid.com (saving the original YouTube video), Audacity (ripping audio and modifying audio), Preview (working with the transparent "bouncing ball train"), and iMovie (placing the "bouncing ball train" and other edits.
